templateAssets.content: THE ARTICULATION AGREEMENT BELOW IS SUBJECT TO PERIODIC REVISION. PLEASE CONSULT A COUNSELOR EVERY SEMESTER TO OBTAIN CURRENT INFORMATION ABOUT POSSIBLE CHANGES IN THE AGREEMENT.

This agreement primarily displays only the lower-division courses required in the major, and a few featured upper-division courses. Although completion of the coursework below is not necessarily mandatory prior to admission, students are strongly advised to complete as much lower division course preparation as possible prior to transfer. This agreement does not contain most upper-division (junior-senior) major requirements, course pre-requisites, general education or all-university coursework necessary for completion of this degree. In some cases, there may be alternative course options at the upper-division level. REFER TO THE FRESNO STATE CATALOG FOR FURTHER INFORMATION: http://www.fresnostate.edu/catalog/

requirementAttributes.content: Course(s) must be taken at university

templateAssets.content:
Criminology courses at the undergraduate level include integration of theoretical and applied materials of an interdisciplinary nature. The undergraduate curriculum is designed to prepare students for beginning professional work in criminal justice and to provide preparation for graduate work.


The Corrections option is designed for students interested in careers in probation, parole, correctional institutions, and other affiliated forms of work.

The Law Enforcement option is designed for students interested in careers with federal, state, and local law enforcement agencies, or law enforcement careers within the private sector.

The Victimology option is designed for students interested in careers in domestic violence programs, rape counseling programs, victim/witness programs, or other victim-related programs at the local, state, or federal level; these programs can either be criminal justice based or community based. An internship course is required in corrections, law enforcement, and victimology options.


Advising Notes

A grade of C or higher is required for all courses to be counted toward the major (excluding CR/NC classes).

  • Students wishing to change their major to Criminology or Forensic Behavioral Sciences will need to have a cumulative GPA of at least 2.5.


In addition to the major program requirements, every student must also complete the University’s baccalaureate degree requirements such as:

  • American Government and Institutions (PLSI 2)
  • General Education Requirements (43 units)
  • Additional University Graduation Requirements (9 units) - 
  • Students with a declared Criminology - Corrections major following a TMC/ADT similar pathway are exempt from this degree requirement.
  •  Students with a declared Criminology - Law Enforcement major following a TMC/ADT similar pathway are exempt from this degree requirement.
  • Students with a declared Criminology - Victimology major following a TMC/ADT similar pathway are exempt from this degree requirement.
  • Upper-Division Writing Requirement
  • ﻿General Education, Additional University Graduation Requirements, and Upper-division Writing courses can be double counted with major requirements. This includes CRIM 50 (Area 2). See advisor for details.
  • Sufficient Elective Units to Meet Required Total Units (varies); it is recommended that units in this area be utilized to complete a second major or minor.

A full description of the University’s graduation requirements can be found in the Baccalaureate Degree Requirements.

course.courseTitle: Statistical and Computer Applications in Criminal Justice
Introductory to Statistics and Data Analysis

templateAssets.content:
Additional University Graduation Requirements


The Additional University Graduation Requirements are designed to complement the GE requirements. It is the policy of Fresno State, that all students will cultivate and refine their affective, cognitive, and physical faculties through studying great works of the human imagination; be equipped for lifelong understanding and development of themselves as integrated physiological, social, and psychological beings; and be prepared to understand and live in a multicultural and international world through their undergraduate education.

This will be accomplished through a total of 9 units from the following areas, each requiring 3 units:

  1. Arts/Humanities (A/H) - All students are required to take an Arts/Humanities course to graduate at the bachelor’s degree level. 
  2. Lifelong-Understanding and Self-Development (L/S) - All students are required to take a lifelong understanding and self-development course to for graduate at the bachelor’s degree level. 
  3. Multicultural/International (M/I) - All Students are required to take a Multicultural / International course at Fresno State to graduate at the bachelor’s degree level.
